item.description:
It's St. Patrick's Day! Let's go to the movies!

The directors of Jeff, Who Lives at Home are the brothers Jay and Mark Duplass. They also directed Cyrus, which starred Jonah Hill, Marisa Tomei, and John C. Reilly. Cyrus was fantastic, and I bet Jeff, Who Lives at Home will be great, too. It stars Jason Segel, Ed Helms, and Susan Sarandon.

*****From the theater website:

In the comedic drama Jeff, Who Lives at Home, slacker Jeff (Jason Segel) looks for signs from the universe to determine his path. As he is dispatched from his basement room on an errand to pick up wood glue for his mother (Susan Sarandon), Jeff just might discover his destiny (finally) when he spends the day with his brother Pat (Ed Helms) as he tracks his possibly adulterous wife. A series of unexpected events thus leads him to cross paths with his family in the strangest of locations and circumstances.

*****

I will purchase my ticket at 6:30 p.m. (maybe a smidge earlier), then wait at the foot of the stairs in the theater lobby. Look for me and my red backpack. At 6:45 p.m., I will move into the theater auditorium. You can find me there if you are late. The movie starts at 7:05 p.m.

After the movie, I will wait in the theater lobby to gather everyone. Look for the red backpack.

If we decide to go out after the movie, be prepared to add 25% to the cost of your order for both the tax and the tip. Bring cash to make paying the restaurant check easier.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend this event so I know who to look for.

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me and my red backpack. See the event description for more details.
item.name: Jeff, Who Lives at Home
